io.codecastle.scriptorium.json

Interface JsonArray<THIS extends JsonArray<THIS>>

  • Type Parameters:
    THIS - this type
    All Superinterfaces:
    Inscribable<JsonArray<?>,THIS>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonArrayDocument, JsonArrayNode

    public interface JsonArray<THIS extends JsonArray<THIS>>
extends Inscribable<JsonArray<?>,THIS>
    Represents a JSON array currently being output.

    Methods named or beginning with the word with return the same object they are called on after outputting any necessary characters.

    Methods named for an output element (element, array, object) return a new object representing a nested structure or context. Calling the returned object's FluentNode.then() method will return this object.

    See Also:
    Json.array(Appendable), array(), JsonKey.array()

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      JsonArrayNode<THIS> array()
      Begins a new JSON array element of this array and returns a JsonArrayNode that can be used to append elements to it.
      JsonValue<THIS> element()
      Begins a new string literal element of this array and returns a JsonValue that can be used to append characters to it.
      JsonValue<THIS> element(char element)
      Begins a new string literal element of this array beginning with the provided character and returns a JsonValue that can be used to append additional characters to it.

      • withAll

        THIS withAll(Object... elements)
      throws IOException
        Appends the provided elements to the array and returns this object.

        Any null elements will be appended as null literals.

        Any non-null CharSequence or Character elements will be appended as double-quoted and escaped string literals.

        Any non-null Byte, Short, Integer, Float, Long, Double, BigInteger, or BigDecimal elements will be appended as numeric literals.

        Any non-null Boolean elements will be appended as Boolean value literals.

        Non-null elements of any other type will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

        If elements is null or empty, this method has no effect.

        Parameters:
        elements - to append to the array
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if a non-null element of an unsupported type is provided
        See Also:
        withAll(Iterable)

      • withAll

        THIS withAll(Iterable<?> elements)
      throws IOException
        Appends the provided elements to the array and returns this object.

        Any null elements will be appended as null literals.

        Any non-null CharSequence or Character elements will be appended as double-quoted and escaped string literals.

        Any non-null Byte, Short, Integer, Float, Long, Double, BigInteger, or BigDecimal elements will be appended as numeric literals.

        Any non-null Boolean elements will be appended as Boolean value literals.

        Non-null elements of any other type will result in an IllegalArgumentException.

        If elements is null or empty, this method has no effect.

        Parameters:
        elements - to append to the array
        Returns:
        this object
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        IllegalArgumentException - if a non-null element of an unsupported type is provided
        See Also:
        withAll(Object...)

      • element

        JsonValue<THIS> element()
                 throws IOException
        Begins a new string literal element of this array and returns a JsonValue that can be used to append characters to it.

        Calling the JsonValue.then() method of the returned JsonValue will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before closing the returned JsonValue may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        When this method returns, an opening double-quote (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will have already been appended to the underlying Appendable.

        Returns:
        a JsonValue representing a new string literal element of this array
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonValue, element(CharSequence), element(char), with(CharSequence), with(Character), with(char)

      • element

        JsonValue<THIS> element(CharSequence element)
                 throws IOException
        Begins a new string literal element of this array beginning with the provided CharSequence and returns a JsonValue that can be used to append additional characters to it.

        Calling the JsonValue.then() method of the returned JsonValue will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before closing the returned JsonValue may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        The contents of the provided CharSequence will be escaped.

        If the provided CharSequence is null, nothing will be prepended to the element. I.e., when this method returns only an opening double-quote (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will be appended to the underlying Appendable

        Parameters:
        element - the beginning characters of the new string literal element
        Returns:
        a JsonValue representing a new string literal element of this array
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonValue, element(), element(Character), element(char), with(CharSequence)

      • element

        JsonValue<THIS> element(char element)
                 throws IOException
        Begins a new string literal element of this array beginning with the provided character and returns a JsonValue that can be used to append additional characters to it.

        Calling the JsonValue.then() method of the returned JsonValue will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before closing the returned JsonValue may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        When this method returns, an opening bracket (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) and the provided character will have already been appended to the underlying Appendable. The provided character will be escaped.

        Parameters:
        element - the first character of the new string literal element
        Returns:
        a JsonValue representing a new string literal element of this array
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonValue, element(), element(CharSequence), element(Character), with(char)

      • element

        default JsonValue<THIS> element(Character element)
                         throws IOException
        Begins a new string literal element of this array beginning with the provided character and returns a JsonValue that can be used to append additional characters to it.

        Calling the JsonValue.then() method of the returned JsonValue will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before closing the returned JsonValue may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        The provided character will be escaped.

        If the provided Character is null, nothing will be prepended to the element. I.e., when this method returns only an opening double-quote (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will be appended to the underlying Appendable

        Parameters:
        element - the first character of the new string literal element
        Returns:
        a JsonValue representing a new string literal element of this array
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        JsonValue, element(), element(CharSequence), element(char), with(char)

      • array

        JsonArrayNode<THIS> array()
                   throws IOException
        Begins a new JSON array element of this array and returns a JsonArrayNode that can be used to append elements to it.

        Calling the JsonArrayNode.then() method of the returned JsonArrayNode will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before closing the returned JsonArrayNode may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        When this method returns, an opening bracket (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will have already been appended to the underlying Appendable

        Returns:
        a JsonArrayNode representing the new JSON array element
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withEmptyArray()

      • object

        JsonObjectNode<THIS> object()
                     throws IOException
        Begins a new JSON object element of this array and returns a JsonObjectNode that can be used to append key-value pairs to it.

        Calling the JsonObjectNode.then() method of the returned JsonObjectNode will return this object.

        Calling any method of this object before closing the returned JsonObjectNode may result in invalid output and/or an unchecked exception.

        When this method returns, an opening brace (preceded by a comma, if appropriate) will have already been appended to the underlying Appendable

        Returns:
        a JsonObjectNode representing the new JSON object element
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        withEmptyObject()
